configuration.description: Enables use of global fields query parameter to filter response to only specified fields. This will override any existing vendor functionality on the connector
configuration.name: Allow Select Fields parameter

configuration.description: Used to enable/disable filtering of null values from the responses
configuration.name: Filter null values from the response

configuration.description: Generic map used to specify default fields for bulk download and GET /all requests. Each key should be the canonical objectName and values may be specified as a comma-delimited string or a list of strings
configuration.name: Default select fields

configuration.description: PipelineDeals Time of Getting Token or Performing Authentication
configuration.name: Time of Getting Token or Performing Authentication

configuration.description: Set time interval for polling application (in minutes)
configuration.name: Event poller refresh interval

configuration.description: Event Poller Resources Configuration. The configuration is defined via JSON, an example of which is as follows - { "contacts": { "url": "/hubs/helpdesk/contacts", “idField”: “user.id”, “datesConfiguration”: { "updatedDateField": "user.updated_at", "updatedDateFormat": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssX", “createdDateField”: “user.created_at”, “createdDateFormat": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssX" }, "pageSize": 10000 } }
configuration.name: Event Poller Resources Configuration

description: CRM service for tracking deals and contacts

resources.description: Get the account information for the authenticated account for this instance.

Find People in PipelineDeals account, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all People whose name contains the word 'jones', the search expression parameter will be person_name='%jones%'. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 30 people will be returned.

parameters.description: The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all People whose name contains the word 'jones', the search expression parameter will be person_name='%jones%'. Note that only =, >, and < are acceptable operators.
parameters.name: where

parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 200 if not supplied
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied
parameters.name: page

resources.description: Create a new contact in PipelineDeals. Contact creation will flow through Cloud Elements.

parameters.description:
The Contact object to be created.
With the exception of the 'id' field, the required fields indicated in the 'Contact' model are those required to create a new contact.
parameters.name: body

resources.description: Delete a contact associated with a given ID from your CRM system.\nSpecifying a contact associated with a given ID that does not exist will result in an error message. .

parameters.description: The ID of the contact to delete from the CRM system.
parameters.name: id

resources.description: Retrieve a contact associated with a given ID from Pipeline. Specifying a contact with an ID that does not exist will result in an error response.

parameters.description: The ID of the contact to retrieve from the CRM system.
parameters.name: id

resources.description: Update the contact associated with the given ID in the CRM system. The update API uses the PATCH HTTP verb, so only those fields provided in the contact object will be updated, and those fields not provided will be left aloneUpdating a contact with a specified ID that does not exist will result in an error response.

parameters.description: The person object, with those fields that are to be updated.
parameters.name: body

parameters.description: The ID of the person to update in PipelineDeals.
parameters.name: id

resources.description: Find Deals in PipelineDeals account, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all Deals whose name contains the word 'baseball', the search expression parameter will be deal_name='%baseball%'. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 deals will be returned.

parameters.description: Start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not specified
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. Note that only =, >, and < are acceptable operators.
parameters.name: where

parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 200 if not supplied
parameters.name: pageSize

resources.description: Create a new deal in PipelineDeals. Contact creation will flow through Cloud Elements.

parameters.description: The deal to be created in PipelineDeals
parameters.name: body

resources.description: Delete a deal associated with a given  ID from PipelineDeals.  Specifying a deal associated with an ID that does not exist will result in an error message.

parameters.description: The ID of the deal to delete from PipelineDeals.
parameters.name: id

resources.description: Retrieve a deal associated with a given ID from Pipeline. Specifying a deal with an ID that does not exist will result in an error response.

parameters.description: The ID of the deal to retrieve from PipelineDeals.
parameters.name: id

resources.description: Update an object associated with a given object name and ID in the CRM system. The update API uses the PATCH HTTP verb, so only those fields provided in the object will be updated, and those fields not provided will be left alone.Updating an object with a specified ID that does not exist will result in an error response.

parameters.description: The deal object, with those fields that are to be updated.
parameters.name: body

parameters.description: The ID of the deal to update in PipelineDeals.
parameters.name: id

resources.description: Returns all saved searches from PipelineDeals account.
Retrieve a list associated with a given ID from PipelineDeals.

parameters.description: The ID of the list to retrieve from PipelineDeals.
parameters.name: id

resources.description: Retrieve contacts present within a list with a given ID from PipelineDeals. Only those fields saved in the list will be returned.

parameters.description: The ID of the list to retrieve.
parameters.name: id

name: PipelineDeals
